description: From Middle French céphalique, from Latin cephalicus (“head”), from Ancient Greek κεφαλικός (kephalikós, “capital”), from κεφαλή (kephalḗ, “head”).

adjectives.description: cephalic (comparative more cephalic, superlative most cephalic)

definitionGroups.group: Of or relating to the head.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the brain.
Of or relating to the cephalon (the head of a trilobite).
(anatomical terms of location and direction) Toward the head; in bipeds such as humans, this direction corresponds to superior.
